result.execSummary:
The defendant April M Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
State will read-in dismiss uncharged Manufacture/Deliver THC 961.41(1)(h)1(PTAC)
DE will provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
DE will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April M Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR (filed in 15CF184)

Defendant April M Richardson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM156.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF184-Ct 2-DE will enter a plea of NC.  Ct's 1,3 will be DRI. 

15CM156-DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept both and find the DE guilty.  

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will order sentence withheld, 2 years probation, CC, DNA sample, surcharge, uncharged count will be DRI, will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.  No discussion of this case with potential witnesses.    No possession or use of mind altering substances, or illicit substances. Curfew from 11:00PM to 6:00AM daily.    DE may be outside the curfew hours as long as DE is at work.
